MS MCQs

    Introduction to Azure Government - Knowledge Check

    »

    1. Which one of the following is a key difference between global Azure and Azure Government?

      Azure Government has a marketplace from which you can deploy pre-built images from Microsoft and partners.

      Azure Government has a portal from which you can manage your resources.

      Azure Government is a physically separate instance of Azure.

      Azure Government uses different technology that global Azure.


    2. How many Azure Governments regions are available?

      4

      12

      7

      8


    3. Azure Government is available exclusively to three distinct types of customers. Which of the following customer types is it NOT available to?

      A US government entity in its governmental capacity, such as a federal agency.

      A private entity building cloud solutions for the private sector.

      A partner using Azure Government to deliver a solution that provides services or solutions to US government customers through direct or indirect contracts.

      A commercial entity with data subject to government regulations.


    4. Which one of the following addresses is the correct URL for accessing the Azure Government portal?

      portal.azure.com

      portal.azure.gov

      portal.azure.us

      portal.azure.fed
